meanings.definition: The quality or state of being periodic.
meanings.sent1: The periodicity of the waves was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The periodicity of the seasons brings a sense of rhythm to nature.
meanings.sent3: The periodicity of the clock's ticking made everyone in the room fall asleep.
meanings.sent4: The periodicity of the music echoed through the hall like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The periodicity of the pendulum swinging back and forth was oddly soothing.

meanings.definition: The tendency to recur at regular intervals.
meanings.sent1: The periodicity of his visits always brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The periodicity of the comet's appearance was predictable by astronomers.
meanings.sent3: The periodicity of the dog's barking annoyed the neighbors every morning.
meanings.sent4: The periodicity of the rain showers was like nature's own schedule.
meanings.sent5: The periodicity of the train's arrival was crucial for commuters to plan their day.

meanings.definition: The quality of being periodic; the tendency to recur at regular intervals.

meanings.sent3: The periodicity of the jokes at the party kept everyone laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The periodicity of the waves crashing against the shore was like nature's heartbeat.
